passage_text: Alsace Grand Cru Wine. Alsace Grand Cru is the appellation for the finest still white wines from the Alsace region of north-eastern France. Created in 1983, the appellation was based on a classification of the region's vineyards carried out in 1975 and has been the subject of several subsequent revisions.

A Grand Cru Champagne. Cru is a vineyard or group of vineyards, especially one of recognized quality. It is a French wine term which is traditionally translated as growth, as it was originally the past participle of the verb croitre (to grow).
Definition of GRAND CRU. : a wine of the highest rank or reputation within its appellation. ADVERTISEMENT.

View Comments. If you see the words Grand Cru or Premier Cru on the label of a bottle of champagne it’s very likely that you will assume that what’s inside the bottle is of a superior quality to a champagne that does not display either of these terms.

At Grand Cru Coffee, we have chosen to use Sanremo Verona TCS coffee machines and Mazzer grinders as our standard equipment. Sanremo Italy is our key espresso machine supplier. For the words Grand Cru to appear on a label all the grapes used to make the champagne in question must come from Grand Cru villages. Similarly a Premier Cru champagne must not contain any grapes from villages rated below 90%.

Origin of GRAND CRU. French, literally, great production (of something grown) — more at cru.
